newsitem.title: INDIA: India alliance party says to pull out of govt - PTI.
newsitem.headline: India alliance party says to pull out of govt - PTI.

text.p: A key constituent of India's ruling United Front coalition said on Saturday it would not participate in a new government, to be headed by new alliance leader Inder Kumar Gujral, the Press Trust of India (PTI) said.

The regional Tamil Maanila Congress (TMC), to which outgoing Finance Minister P. Chidambaram belongs, said it would continue to back the government but from outside the coalition, United News of India said.
The decision was taken minutes after the coalition announced that Gujral would be its new leader. TMC leader G.K. Moopanar had been considered a front-runner for the post.
The southern Indian TMC has three other ministers in the outgoing United Front government, which lost a parliamentary vote of confidence on April 11, PTI said.
The news agencies gave no other details.
